data.title: Welcome page and interactive playground code should lazy load when the feature is disabled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Quite a lot of welcome page code appears to be getting loaded even when the feature is disabled. We should avoid loading the majority of the code on start up but defer to when/if it's used. Dynamic imports could help: https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-2-4.html /cc @jrieken

data.title: Format on Save is laggy
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set "editor.formatOnSave" to true.
2. Save any file. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

You'll notice vscode just sort of hangs for ~2 seconds after a file is saved.

data.title: Receive error Opening file on local OneDrive folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16257
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
python|don|0.7.0
xml|Dot|1.9.2
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
csharp|ms-|1.12.1

When trying to open a file in my local synced onedrive folder, I get the error message:

Path Does Not Exist
The path 'C:\Users\Paul\OneDrive\Documents\FileName.txt' does not seem to exist anymore on disk.

I can open the file with Notepad, Wordpad and visual studio with no issue.
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select File Open
2. Select file in onedrive documents folder on my local machine

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2349276/29582212-d91b939a-8749-11e7-94cf-dd182a1f385d.png)

data.title: Search and replace on a very large file causes VS Code to crash
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a very large file (mine was a 115MB yml file)
2. CTRL + H
3. Type the string to search for and the replacement (999+ instances were found)
4. Choose Replace All
5. VS Code crashes

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12971179/29581460-2e561c48-872e-11e7-9189-e6f1aa13e8d9.png)

I I replace just one instance, it doesn't crash.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: [Ubuntu] Toggling dev tools
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a custom keyboard shortcut to "workbench.action.toggleDevTools" i.e Ctrl+Shift+I (seems to also happen with other shortcuts)
2. Use the shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+I) to open the dev tools
3. Close the dev tools with the shortcut again
4. Repeat steps 2 and 3
5. VSCode crashes

I then noticed that even without the shortcut, just opening/closing a few times with the menu makes it crash

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

I have Debugger for Chrome/Auto-open Markdown Preview and TSLint installed. I haven't tried uninstalling them but I disabled all/reloaded vscode and I still have the issue.

Let me know if you need any more information! Thanks.

data.title: HTML Language Server throw a error,when click the annotation!
API to create custom Activity Bar items and Panels with Extensions
data.body:
I have been unable to find any information on whether or not vs code has any plans to support the functionality to allow extensions to create new activity bar items and/or side bar panels. 

Would be useful for creating many types of extensions (team chat, project/time management, sql explorers, cli tool integration (docker, npm, composer, webpack, vagrant, etc...), even less obvious things like music players and documentation). I'm aware that a lot of these extensions exist, but they aren't easily accessible (open command palette, search for extension, select option, enter command...). 

This type of functionality would potentially allow myself and many other developers to work in vs code without ever having to open another tool or leave the editor. 

If this is something that would be considered, I would be willing to work on it. Thanks!

data.title: help with launch.json, php, xdebug
data.body:
I'm having a laravel(php) project, and having Xdebug working in vscode. But unfortunately doing this in a two step. I want to combine it into one.

What I'm doing now i write: 1. in cmd:
`php -S localhost:1000 -t public`
have a vscode > debug > launch.json
```
    {
    "name": "Listen for XDebug",
    "type": "php",
    "request": "launch",
    "port": 9000
     },
```
How can i combine this into one task?

I've try'ed to create the 1. part as a task, but didnt work.

task.json:

```
        {
        "taskName": "PhpServe",
        "type": "shell",
        "command": "php -S localhost:1000 -t public"
    }
```
launch.json

```
        {
        "name": "Listen for XDebug",
        "type": "php",
        "request": "launch",
        "preLaunchTask": "phpServe",
        "port": 9000
    },
```
the php server start up, and run until i close it. After i close it Xdebug start up.. not what i want.

How do i launch php server and xdebug at the same time?

data.title: Break Points do not clear for Powershell
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
xml|Dot|1.9.2
vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.8
rest-client|hum|0.15.2
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
team|ms-|1.122.0
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.8.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a powershell file
2. Set a breakpoint by clicking left of the number
3. Hit F5
4. Run your powershell
5. You should break on the breakpoint set in step 2
6. Step over until the code completed
7. Clear the breakpoint you set in step 2 the same way you set it
8. Run your powershell
9. Breakpoint hits again

Note:
If you type - Get-PSBreakPoint it will output the breakpoints you set in step 2 and tried to clear in Step 7. 
Type Get-PSBreakPoint | Remove-PsBreakPoint to remove the break points and you should be able to run the code again without it stopping.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

After I tried to confirm without extensions, I realized that all contents of the directory has actually been deleted (vscode showed the files as still present) - only the directory I was actually deleting remained behind. Weird. Also after trying on another dir, I could not reproduce the problem. :-(

Steps to (not) Reproduce:

1. try to delete non-empty dir, confirming direct delete after binning fails
2. error message pops up: `A system error occurred (ENOTEMPTY: directory not empty, rmdir 'z:\fooo\bar')`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

This has happened to me for the last 4 updates of VSCode (I wasn't certain if it was another process or not), and also just happened with the 64-bit install. At the very end of the install, before the step that indicates that the installation has completed, my entire PC freezes and will not accept keyboard or mouse input.

data.title: Project folder fails to open
data.body:
# The issue
I'm unable to open project folders in VS Code - attempting to open one results in seemingly nothing happening. However, going to the desired folder and running `code . --verbose --disable-extensions` gives:
```
Unable to read folders in /Users/kabir/Library/Application Support/Code/Workspaces (Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, scandir '/Users/kabir/Library/Application Support/Code/Workspaces').
```

Reinstalling VS Code worked initially, but then the issue started occurring again.

# Details

data.title: VSCode URI module's driveLetterPath regex is incorrect
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-uri/blob/e59cab84f5df6265aed18ae5f43552d3eef13bb9/lib/index.ts#L56

The regex is `[a-zA-z]`, the `A-z` part will match ascii characters such as `^` and `_`.

This was spotted by @deathaxe when porting the module over for use in the Python Language Server https://github.com/palantir/python-language-server/pull/99/files

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Freezes on Search with "one line file" in result (typically map files)
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 professional

Steps to Reproduce:
In a JS project using webpack for example
1. Search for a String
2.If the result as a "one line" file to show, the search tab freezes during several seconds.
3. Scroll so the file disappear "Search" behaving correctly
4. Scroll back until the file appears again, it freezes

File example :  0.chunk.js.map

From my point of view seems like it's creating a tooltip with the whole file inside.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: TreeItem: add icons support

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If we put this string: `this is an icon -> $(cloud-upload)` in a quickpick item then `$(cloud-upload)` will be replaced with an icon. This is not the case for a `TreeItem`.

Other than looking like an inconsistency to me I think it's also a quite useful feature that should be implemented. My [Projects+](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabiospampinato.vscode-projects-plus) extension uses icons to provide extra information, which because of this issue it cannot provide in it's new `TreeDataProvider` I'm working on.

I know that it's possible to define a `iconPath` property that adds an icon, but it's just 1 icon, and one cannot choose where it should be rendered.

What do you think?

data.title: No way to setup the shell utf-8 encoding in windows.

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1703

I need to change shell encoding to utf-8, because default encoding not showing up cyrillic symbols. Only way to do this that I found is adding shell args as described in #19837. But when I use tasks with this workaround error happens. "Parameter format not correct - /d" for cmd and "Parameter format not correct - -Command" for powershell. There is no way to change shell encoding and use tasks both.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup ```"terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows": ["-NoExit", "/c", "chcp 65001"]``` in configuration
2. Run any task (E. g. build)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Intellisense inside JS template literal not showing automatically after typing ${
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1703

Steps to Reproduce:

While typing inside the string interpolation, e.g.`${foo}`, Intellisense popup for the variable is not shown.

Intellisense regarding the variable's property works perfectly though.
But, It's the variable name that popup doesn't open when typing.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Visual Studio Code for MacOS will not update!
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code
2. Browse Extensions
3. Wait for VSCode Update Message
4. "Do you want to update?" Click "Yes"
5. Update will request password
6. After keying in credentials, application will close
7.  I'm forced to start again and replay the above.

data.title: Add command to close file below keyboard cursor
data.body:
Here is what happened when i hit CMD+W (close file on MacOs) while i'm in the "opened files" block : 
Steps to Reproduce:
![closecurrent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5599375/29564013-4f058fb6-8740-11e7-83bd-3cf8a3174d74.gif)

Current behaviour : 
- the CMD+W (MacOs) close the active file, event if we focus another one in opened file.

Expected option : 
- the CMD+W (MacOs) close the active focus opened file without focusing it in editor.

data.title: $ characters colorized as keyword in regex literal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
php-intellisense|fel|1.5.1
auto-close-tag|for|0.4.3
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
team|ms-|1.122.0
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
---

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create ASP.NET Core 2 project from Visual Studio 2017 template
2. Open webpack.config.js

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9047283/29563876-cb14f37c-873f-11e7-8de1-bf3c75834567.png)

or just type `/$/`.

They get the same CSS class as the `const` keyword for example.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

In Visual Studio 2017 it works fine, $ is not highlighted:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9047283/29563923-fa3f0912-873f-11e7-890b-042716b68969.png)
